III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Child and Family Services-Livingston has a main office in Howell, MI and a satellite
office in Monroe, MI.
The Howell office is located on the second floor of a professional building complex with
approximately eight other suites. Consumers enter the agency through a main hallway
and into a small foyer/waiting area that contains a telephone to connect with agency
staff. The agency contains six cubicles and two work stations along with two supervisor
offices. Foster care, licensing, and adoption case files are stored separately in locked
file cabinets within a locked file/copy room. The file room is able to be accessed
through an area adjacent to the cubicles and through an adjoining office manager’s
office. The agency has appropriate office equipment including a cross cut shredder to
destroy confidential information. The agency also rents a separate suite that serves as
a training room with kitchenette, which also contains a separate and private visitation
room.
The Monroe office is also located in a professional building complex with two other
suites. Consumers also enter the agency through a main hallway and into a small
foyer/waiting area that contains a telephone to connect with agency staff. The main
area of the agency contains an office manager’s office, five cubicles, one visitation
room, and a file/copy room. Foster care, and adoption case files are stored separately
in locked file cabinets within the locked file/copy room. Licensing files are stored at the
main office site in Howell. The file room is able to be accessed through the area
adjacent to the cubicles. The back of the main area contains one supervisor office.
Down the hall from the main entrance is a locked conference room, which contains a
kitchenette, as well as another visitation room. The agency has appropriate office
equipment including a cross cut shredder to destroy confidential information.
2

B. Program Description
Family and Community Services-Livingston has operated as a satellite office to Family
and Community Services-Macomb, license number CB500316267, since 03/2015 and
in its current Howell location since 09/2015. The agency expanded its operation to
include another satellite office in Monroe in 10/2015. Due to Family and Community
Services expansion, a separate license for the Howell location is being secured with the
Monroe satellite office attached to Family and Community Services-Livingston’s license.
Family and Community Services-Livingston is a child placing agency that certifies foster
homes for licensure and places children in foster homes in southeast Michigan referred
through the Department of Health and Human Services. The agency also evaluates
applicants for adoption and place children for adoption through referrals made through
the Department of Health and Human Services as well. The agency will provide
certification orientation and ongoing training to perspective and current foster families.
Perspective adoptive parents will be oriented to the adoption process and be evaluated.
The agency will also provide referrals for adoption post-finalization services, as needed.
Child and Family Services-Livingston will coordinate services to families served within
foster care as well.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
Child and Family Services-Livingston’s policies and procedures and supporting
documentation have been reviewed and are determined as appropriate. There is no
rule or statutory violations currently noted.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Issuance of a provisional license to this private child placing agency is
recommended.
